Comments_List: an understanding of influence across the Greek literary tradition; an understanding of how the literature we have survived to us; literary appreciation of motifs etc; ability to read most Greek dialects

I developed better Greek reading skills through exposure to various genres. I also learned general information, contextual and historical, about the various authors and genres. Overall I have a better grasp of the bigger picture of epic and lyric poetry and learned through this course how to synthesize the big picture with the little details.
My Greek improved, and I learned more about Greek literature.

The greatest strength of this course is that we get through a significant amount of Greek in a very short time. One thing that could help is if we more systematically tackled the background information for each poet (perhaps grouping each poet by date or by genre/style/content for the lyric poets would help).
I think that the course is well-designed.
Yes, I would recommend this course because it helps one improve Greek and gain some familiarity with multiple authors and periods.
